alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 4:45PM EST until further notice by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring and is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following county, Ottawa. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...A significant ice jam has formed on the Grand River near Robinson Township. Flooding is occuring at low-lying and flood-prone areas including Limberlost Lane and Van Lopik Avenue. The ice remains jammed up in this area, and additional shifting of the ice and thickening of the ice jam is possible this evening and overnight. This may lead to additional rising water and significant flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 433 PM EST, local Emergency Officials confirm flooding is happening and the ice continues to move and shift. - Ice jams are notoriously unpredictable, and can lead to water level rising much faster than normal for the Grand River. Anyone living in this area should prepare for rising water and flooding, and have a plan to move to safety on very short notice. The ice jam should slowly move downstream over the next few days, expanding the flooding risk to downstream of the highway 231 bridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
